page.title: 09The Nypro Explosion 2
page.content: In May 1974 I had been teaching at Burton School for six weeks and was visiting relatives when news of the explosion was flashed on to the T.V. screen.When I returned home the next day I could see the flames and I live some 20 km from Flixborough.I was unable to contact anyone by telephone."The area has been evacuated .It's like a scene from a war film,"said the operator.The scale of the damage was quite stunning.In school 165 panes of glass were broken,some glass was found impaled in the wall opposite the broken window.My own classroom was directly in line and one of the nearest yet suffered no damage -seven books were on the floor.The children's education was interrupted for a week.My lasting memory is the noise made when one walks on broken glass.
